description: Smart LLM router with x402 micropayments - legitimately requires wallet key for payment signing

expectedBehaviors.justification: OpenClaw Router uses this wallet key to sign USDC payment transactions on Base L2. The key is used LOCALLY for cryptographic signing and is NEVER transmitted over the network. This is required for x402 protocol compliance.

securityNotes: The wallet key is used solely for EIP-712 signature generation
Signatures are transmitted, not the private key itself
Users fund their own wallets - OpenClaw Router does not custody funds
All payment signing happens client-side in the proxy
Source code is MIT licensed and fully auditable
